body: MAL Chord is an interactive chord diagram that allows you to view your anime history in a unique way.
Would you like a tour of the app?
General user-related information lives here - wow you've watched a lot of anime!
Try clicking your username to navigate to your MAL profile (not available for Guest users).
MAL Chord caters for both manga readers and anime watchers.
Try clicking and selecting your preferred media type or use the arrow keys when focused on the dropdown.
The chord diagram can get VERY busy when you've watched a lot of anime. Use this filter to increase/decrease the total number of anime shown.
Try scrolling or clicking and typing on the text.
Have you accidently clicked something? No worries - use the undo/redo buttons to fix that!
Try clicking the buttons or using tradition undo/redo shortcut keys (CTRL-Y/Z).
Here you can select different categories to group your anime - our favourite is by studio or author!
Try clicking and selecting a category or use the arrow keys when focused on the dropdown.
By default, the chord diagram sorts your anime by the ones you have last updated. Use the highlighted options to change the sort type and direction.
Try selecting a new sort and changing the sort direction.

header: I want to know! Tell me more 🧐
body: Want to know more about a specific node? You can interact with each node to bring up more information.
Try left clicking on the node to bring up more details.
Links between nodes can be highlighted or hidden to help you read your chart more effectively.
Try right clicking on the node to bring up the hide/highlight menu.
Chord diagrams can be exported as PDFs to allow for simple sharing and printing. Your current selection (including all filters and sorts) will be used for the export.
Try clicking the highlighted button to bring up the printing modal.
I hope you enjoy using MAL Chord!
This help can be accessed again at any time through the highlighted button.
